comment: Caring teacher, knowledgeable. Slides are informative and intuitive. Relatively easy quizzes for each chapter/open-book. Tests are fair (info covered in class). Class attendance heavily recommended for better understanding of material. Test questions have answers that give half-credit if correct answer (for full credit) not chosen.

I literally love her. Her lectures are great and she's so friendly and approachable, so asking questions isn't too scary. Her tests are reasonable, not too easy but not hard if you study. Offers a lot of study materials. Homework is very light and manageable. Take her!

I loved her energy, she was so charismatic!! Lab instructions were broken down in detail which made it easier to do the lab efficiently. There is a post lab quiz after every lab with 3 attempts (can be done in 1 due to the simplicity). Easy to contact her and she regularly updates students before next lab. Highly recommend taking her!!! 10/10.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor was insufferable, often wasting class time venting about unrelated issues. Her teaching style is niche and didn't work for me. She also accused my entire group of plagiarism but admitted she couldn't prove it. The whole experience was frustrating—save yourself the headache and avoid SCM if possible.

I had her for some random CSM class, it was easy. She's very nice and engages with the class a lot. The assignments weren't difficult as long as you payed attention in class. There was a lot of group work which is nice. She's an easy grader and gives good feedback.

Dr. Hesser is an amazing professor. I hated her in-person lectures because she would talk too much about unrelated things. Her classes are super early in the morning and I can't deal with that. Exams are straight forward. Great professor but me personally, I wouldn't take her again. She's super understanding about missed assignments and stuff. 4/10

I had prof Hesser for a random SCM prep class but she was a super great teacher and super out-going. Not a harsh grader at all and genuinely wants a good class culture. The assignments for the class were super annoying and mainly done in groups (that never changed) but that was decided beyond her control. I hope to take one of her Bio classes soon

Has study guides for exams. Very helpful. Has recorded lectures from a previous school year. Exams cover 3 chapters. Final is cumulative. Not too heavy on lecture but concepts are kind of difficult. For lab, has pre & post quizzes & 1 paper. Also has physiology presentation to do with a paper. Mine was on physiology of blue light filters & eyes.

Dr. Hesser is an amazing teacher for lecture and lab. She is funny and makes learning about human physiology fun and interesting. She is very laid back and gives you all the resources you need to do well in the course. 3 exams and a final with some pre-lecture quizzes you can get bonus points for in lecture. Lab has worksheets and one project

My favorite professor I've ever had! One of the most caring professors, if not the most. Clear grading criteria. 4 exams, including the final, with extra credit on each. Homework consists of pre-quizzes, also with bonus points built in. So accessible outside of class. She cares so much about her students' success! Also, she's HILARIOUS! Take her!
Dr. Hesser was an amazing professor. If you do the work, come to lectures, and do the study guides; there shouldn't be any reason you don't get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: you can't go wrong with taking her! the class is straight-forward, easy to follow, she is so kind, and attendance is only mandatory certain days, which she will tell you about! Take her!!

Dr. Hesser is a real gem. She made the labs very easy to understand and was available for questions. There is one quiz per lab (usually pretty easy) and a paper/presentation on a human phys system of your choice at the end of the semester. If you're choosing b/w taking her and someone else- pick her.
DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND TAKE HESSER FOR EVERYTHING. SHE IS SO AMAZING. TOOK HER FOR BOTH LECTURE AND LAB. STUDY HARD FOR LECTURE! SHOW UP AND PARTICIPATE IN LAB AND YOU WILL DO GREAT.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Hesser is super chill and understanding! The class is test heavy: has mc, matching, and free response questions! Take good and detailed notes, rewatch lectures, and DO THE STUDY GUIDES! And then memorize everything on it! Made over a 100 in the class, but some do terrible on the tests because they dont work hard. Tests are easy if you study!

Dr. Hesser is a solid choice for this class! She reply to emails fast, available for office hours, and tries to makes lectures engaging. There were 3 exams, 1 final, and 11 quizzes and she offers a bunch of extra credit. The tests are lockdown+webcam, but come straight from the PPTs/quizzes. She looks for details when grading the free response.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Hesser is just amazing. She is SO helpful and available outside of class. She is so inspirational, easy to talk to, and accommodating to all students. Her HP class is indeed very hard, but she gives the fairest exams I have ever taken at KSU. If it's on the study guides she makes for every chapter, then it's on the test. 11/10 professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: she is the best professor I've had at KSU. she is very direct on what she expects on exams! she does participation points and group projects that are actually interesting. she is funny & you can tell she loves to teach. any questions? she will take the time to answer you. she made Human Physiology very fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: The reason behind me getting a C was because, she would expect us to read out the book and be able to understand the subject that way. I feel that she needs to understand that not everyone can sit down with a book and understand the physiology portion. If you aren't good at reading and understanding the subject, I don't recommend her.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great prof, you just need to make sure you put in the time to study. There's only 4 tests including the final, all worth the same. Come to class, listen, and take notes. Homework is done online through pearson, easy 100. She posts her ppt's on D2l before the unit begins, def recommend!

Dr. Hesser is an amazing professor and solid choice for A&P. Her lectures are engaging and will keep you interested. No surprises on her exams. Whatever she lectures about is what will be on the exam. She's a fair grader, kind, and wants her students to do well. Definitely take her!

MY FAVORITE PROFESSOR AT KSU. WOW!!! Cannot stress enough how incredible Hesser is! Super kind, hilarious, and the fairest grader ever! Literally lectures exactly what's on the tests and study guides. This class was so interesting and if you put in the work, very attainable A/High B. loved her and wished she taught more of my other classes! 1000/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Hesser can make lectures really funny, specially the reproductive ones. The tests were easy and straight forward. She also gives partial credit for some answers, so she's willing to help you grade wise as much as she can.

Hesser is a really good option for A&P, she teaches things in a way thats easier to understand. Im taking her again for A&P2 because shes really good. If you get the opportunity to take her, take her. Its a hard class and she makes it easier.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Definitely a professor that explains hard material in a way that students can learn and receive the information the best way possible. This is a hard class, so a professor such as Hesser will help you stay engaged

Hesser was an awesome professor. She was not boring during lectures and her tests are 100 questions with 5 bonus questions. Attendance is not mandatory but she does minute papers at the end of random classes and you get bonus at the end of the semester if you turn in 9 out of 10. I am already registering to take her A&P 2 class next semester.

Great Professor. Cares about her students. 3 tests and 1 final that is cumulative. She gives you a CLEAR idea of what is going to be on tests. Class isn't mandatory, but she's not specific on her slides, so going to class helps. Has lots of practice. Homework due almost every class.

Do Hesser is great. I took her for lab and am now signed up to taker for for a&p 2 lecture. She's very straight forward so you know exactly what to study and she wants her students to succeed. Very helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Prof Hesser lectures the entire 75mins. She provides power points on D2L, so I suggest using them to take notes on during lecture. DO THE MASTERING A&P PRACTICE QUESTIONS - not required, but exams have similar questions. I found the learning objectives to be time consuming, but others highly recommend. 4 exams worth 22.5% each and 10% online HW.

She is a good choice considering anatomy at KSU isn't the easiest. Buy the textbook... it will help you a lot when studying for the test. Pay attention to the learning objectives she gives. DONT CRAM FOR TESTS... BIG MISTAKE.
The class content is hard but if you go to lecture she explains the material thoroughly and makes it way easier to understand. She also makes things light-hearted and interesting.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Hesser's A&P is relatively easy compared to other A&P classes. However you do have to work for that A. Use the learning objectives and understand the material before the test.

This is a hard class. Hesser is a teacher who knows her stuff, but you have to go to class if you want any hope of passing. She's a nice lady, but her tests are insanely hard and tricky. I still think she's one of the best options for A&P, but she's not easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: AMAZING. She made everything clear and easy to understand, but didn't hide the fact that the topics were difficult. You definitely have to study everyday, but the LO she gives are so helpful. She doesn't post power points, but she does give lecture outlines. Super nice, easy to understand and was very patient with questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I had Dr. Hesser for Human Physiology lecture and lab. The lab is easy, but the lecture is more difficult. Attendance can help, so just go to class. Her tests and lengthy and difficult and she grades pretty tough. She is very detailed, so be sure to answer the question thoroughly. I recommend her, just be prepared.

She is a very strait-forward professor. If you do the learning objectives that she gives, and actually study, you will do well on her tests. A&P is a lot of information, thats what makes will make  it difficult. If you're not ready to put in the work I can promise you, you wont do well.

Her tests are definitely not given to trick or challenge you, but instead given to show if you studied the information or not. I used her learning objectives in detail and got a high B to low A on all the tests. It is a lot of information! The Heart chap. is the worst but she is definitely there to help you not hurt you. Also gives chap. outlines!

Having Hesser teach bio courses when she is a nursing prof was a bad idea. Wrong A LOT in the CVA lab. Basic info in lecture but expects you to know in detail for the study guide & test. Reviewed 15+ pg of notes for each exam. If you don't explain things the way she wants it, points deducted even if you're correct. Honestly, just take Ganser.

Super easy tests! If you do not make an A on every test, you are doing something wrong. She is very, very clear on what you need to know for the tests as well, and the study guides are all you need. I did them the night before the test every time and got a 97-100 on every test, but I do have a degree in Biology.

A&P II is a difficult subject as it is, so if you aren't willing to put in the work, you can't expect to pass this course. That said, this professor was good. She is funny and tries her best to make the material interesting. Her lectures are not enough to make an A, I used my book to supplement quite a bit (something I didn't have to do for A&P 1).

A&P2 is not an easy class at all but Hesser is very clear &explains everything in a straightforward way. She is such a knowledgeable prof &does a really good job in relying the information. Everything is on her ppts & lectures, but book def helps! Every quiz & test has a some extra credit ques. She drops lowest quiz grade. Shes always there to help

She's a really great teacher who cares a lot about her students. Anatomy is a hard class in itself because its a lot of info, but she makes it interesting and definitely doable. Her tests are straightforward and she gives great lectures with notes & helpful visual aids. TAKE HER TAKE HER! If you are willing to try, you can get an A.

She is amazing! One of the best teachers I've had. Really down to earth and enjoys helping her students learn the material. I would definitely take her again. She gives you everything you need to get an A you just have to do the work.

You don't need a textbook for this class. Everything in this class is pretty easy. You have homework online about once a week and the answers are in the notes. Her tests are straight up the study guide, so if you do the study guide you will most likely get an A. Attendance is pretty important but you can miss a class here and there.

Great professor, would take again in a heartbeat. Wish she would teach a 2108 class so I could finish out Biological principles with her. Fearing that the KSU merger will leave this being the only class I will be able to take with her.......

You won't need the textbook, but it's useful for studying. Online HW and in-class assignments are pretty easy. Do your study guides. Her exam questions are often similar to the study guide but spun from a different angle. It requires you to really know the material. She's really nice and welcomes off-topic questions, so long as they're bio-related.

Fall2013 Your grade is up to you. Her lectures cover nearly everything you need. I took little notes, I mainly paid attention her, she provides the slides online. The book was not required but was very helpful. Homework was easy. Some in class group assignments. Use the study guide and get an A. She is a great teacher, very fair and organized.

I tried giving her a chance at first, but not anymore. I basically waste my time during her class because for the majority of the time,we just take notes. The notes are from the book and the notes are online. We do little in-class assignments that aren't hard. She gives super long study guides. They don't help me at all. Consider someone else.

Labs were not difficult but were very time consuming. Homework is ridiculous easy, usually contain 5 problems whose answers can be copied and pasted for the power points she puts up online for you. Her lectures can be dry at times as she tends to read off them, she has her moments of fun though. Always willing to answer questions and help you out.
